revision.comment: [[WP:AWB/GF#Talk page general fixes|Talk page general fixes]] & other cleanup using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text: {{talkheader}}{{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=22:03, 11 November 2011 (UTC) |action1link=Talk:Dolbadarn Castle/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=460193673 |currentstatus=GA |topic=War }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=GA|British=yes|Medieval=yes|Fortifications=yes}} {{WikiProject Architecture|class=GA|importance=}} {{WikiProject Wales|class=GA|importance=low}} }} ==Untitled== I've deleted the reference to "one last battle" in Dolbadarn "in around 1400" during the Glyndŵr revolt. This was news to me. I can find no reference to it in the most authoritative and thorough account of the revolt, R. R. Davies' ''The Revolt of Owain Glyn Dŵr'' (Oxford University Press, 1995). [[User:Enaidmawr|Enaidmawr]] 23:42, 26 September 2006 (UTC) == Who built it? == The article states the castle was built '''by''' the princes. I know it is very nitpicky, but isn't it absurd to think the princes built a castle? Shouldn't it state that the castle was built '''for''' the princes? -- [[User:Kainaw|Kainaw]][[User_talk:Kainaw|(what?)]] 03:00, 15 August 2007 (UTC) :Logically, your comment makes sense. However this is standard historical terminology and you'll find similar examples on every page on history subjects (and in every language, probably). "[[Alexander the Great]] conquered [[Asia]]" and "[[Julius Caesar]] invaded [[Britain]]." We all know they didn't do so singlehandedly! [[User:Enaidmawr|Enaidmawr]] 22:19, 15 August 2007 (UTC) == Spelling etc == Spelled "Dolbadern Castle" in [[Simon Schama]]'s Power of Art series episode about Turner (at 7.25). [[User:Manytexts|Manytexts]] ([[User talk:Manytexts|talk]]) 10:52, 15 December 2010 (UTC) :As was the case with medieval words, there are variations. You can see [http://www.gatehouse-gazetteer.info/Welshsites/101.html here] that there are articles titled "Dolbadam Castle" and "Dolbadarn Castle"; Schama appears to have invented his own spelling, but as the guidebooks published by Her Majesty's Stationary Office (HMSO) use "Dolbadarn Castle" I don't think there's any need to change the article. [[User:Nev1|Nev1]] ([[User talk:Nev1|talk]]) 18:09, 15 December 2010 (UTC) == Expansion... == I've gone through and given the article a thorough scrub. Everything now has reasonable references and I've added a plan in. I've taken out one or two minor bits where I couldn't find any supporting material in the literature. [[User:Hchc2009|Hchc2009]] ([[User talk:Hchc2009|talk]]) 16:27, 23 October 2011 (UTC) == Pics of Paintings == Painting by Philippe Loutherbourg (which is quite important for the british landscapepainting) here: http://www.bbc.co.uk/arts/yourpaintings/paintings/view-of-snowdon-with-the-castle-of-dolbadarn-from-llanberi47557. Don't know if its allowed by british copyrights to insert the pic itself. Please consider it... — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:QbA|QbA]] ([[User talk:QbA|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/QbA|contribs]]) 14:42, 2 May 2012 (UTC)
